summary: The Energy Transitions Initiative Authorization Act of 2025 directs the Secretary of Energy to establish a grant program for developing resilient energy systems in remote, island, and Tribal communities. The bill authorizes up to $5,000,000 grants, with a cost-share requiring grantees to cover at least 10% of project costs. It defines eligible entities (states, local governments, tribal communities, community organizations) and projects (energy efficiency, renewable energy systems, microgrids). The Comptroller General will audit the initiative annually. $31,000,000 is authorized annually for fiscal years 2026-2030.
